timeline.message: refactor(e2e): Prevent exceptions during tear down from failing twin e2e tests

fix(e2e): Fix tpm provisioning tests not being run in serial

These tests need exclusive access to the TPM, so they cannot run in parallel

timeline.bodyText: why does it throw in those flaky instances? doesn't that indicate a problem? doesn't swallowing that exception mean we are ignoring a potential issue?
timeline.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: We have tests where closing the client is part of the code under test, but this isn't one of them
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: that doesn't explain why it throws here though
replies.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: I can take this out for now. I'm more interested in the TPM changes anyways
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: I was under the impression that we generally don't fail a test if the cleanup fails, but this may be worth more discussion
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: did you forget to remove this?
timeline.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: No, this is more of an explanation of why we don't run these tests for pull request builds
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: The TODO is just me being optimistic that we will eventually fix these tests to not be flakey
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: So was this not referenced earlier?
timeline.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: The TPM tests were being run previously. They were just returned as inputs above alongside x509 and symmetric key. This PR just splits the TPM tests into their own class so they can be run in serial while still running the x509 and symmetric key tests in parallel
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.message:
Revert "refactor(e2e): Prevent exceptions during tear down from failing twin e2e tests"

This reverts commit 9f9d0509d8f620e221ab281fe3aa647eb234e8e4.
